title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
body: A woman's perfect life takes a dark turn when she shoots her husband and then refuses to speak. A psychotherapist tries to uncover her secrets.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
body: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast, a young woman who lives in the marsh becomes a suspect in the murder of a local golden boy.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
body: A woman finds herself in a library between life and death where she can explore different versions of her life and decide which one is truly worth living.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
body: An astronaut wakes up with amnesia on a spaceship and must piece together his mission to save humanity from an extinction-level threat.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
body: An Artificial Friend named Klara observes the world from her place in a store, hoping to be chosen by a child. When she is, she learns about love, loss, and sacrifice.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
body: A reclusive Hollywood star chooses an unknown magazine reporter to tell her life story, revealing shocking secrets about her seven marriages.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
body: In the distant future, a noble family becomes embroiled in a power struggle over the harsh desert planet Arrakis, the only source of the valuable substance melange.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
body: A case worker in charge of magical youth is sent to investigate an orphanage on a remote island and discovers a secret that will change his life.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
body: A young huntress is taken to a magical land after killing a faerie wolf and finds herself caught up in a dangerous game of love and power.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
body: A retelling of the Trojan War from the perspective of Patroclus, the exiled young prince who becomes Achilles' closest companion.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
body: A disgraced journalist and a young female hacker team up to investigate the disappearance of a young woman from a wealthy family.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
body: In Nazi Germany, a young girl steals books to learn to read and finds solace in stories amidst the horrors of war.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
body: Seconds before Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect.

author: George Orwell
body: In a dystopian future, a man rebels against a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of life and thought.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
body: In the racially charged South, a lawyer defends a black man accused of rape and teaches his children about justice and empathy.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
body: In 19th-century England, the Bennet sisters navigate love, marriage, and societal expectations.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: In Middle-earth, a hobbit named Frodo Baggins embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
body: On his eleventh birthday, Harry Potter learns that he is a wizard and is invited to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
body: A disillusioned teenager named Holden Caulfield wanders around New York City after being expelled from prep school.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
body: The March sisters grow up during the Civil War, learning about love, loss, and the importance of family.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
body: A symbologist and a cryptologist follow a trail of clues hidden in Da Vinci's artwork to uncover a secret that could shake the foundations of Christianity.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
body: On their fifth wedding anniversary, Nick Dunne's wife Amy disappears, and he becomes the prime suspect in her disappearance.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
body: A woman who takes the same commuter train every day becomes obsessed with a couple she sees from the train and finds herself involved in a murder mystery.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
body: In a dystopian future, a teenage girl named Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
body: Two cancer patients meet at a support group and fall in love, learning about life, loss, and the importance of living in the moment.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
body: A young shepherd named Santiago follows his dreams and travels to Egypt in search of treasure, learning about life's journey and listening to his heart.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
body: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island and are killed off one by one, following the pattern of a nursery rhyme.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
body: In the 1960s, a young white woman in Mississippi writes a book about the experiences of black maids, exposing the racism and injustice of the time.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
body: A spoiled young girl discovers a secret garden on her uncle's estate and learns about friendship, nature, and the power of hope.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry
body: A pilot stranded in the desert meets a young prince who has fallen to Earth from a tiny asteroid, and learns about love, loss, and the importance of imagination.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
body: In a dystopian future where women have no rights, a woman named Offred is forced to serve as a Handmaid, bearing children for the ruling class.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
body: A family becomes isolated in a haunted hotel during the winter, and the father descends into madness, terrorizing his wife and son.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
body: An astronaut is stranded on Mars after a mission goes wrong and must use his ingenuity and scientific knowledge to survive until rescue.

title: The Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
body: A group of British boys are stranded on a deserted island after their plane crashes, and their society descends into savagery and violence.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
body: A young man sells his soul to maintain his youthful beauty, and his portrait reflects his moral decay.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
body: In the Roaring Twenties, a mysterious millionaire named Jay Gatsby throws lavish parties in hopes of reuniting with his lost love, Daisy Buchanan.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bront√´
body: An orphaned young woman becomes a governess at Thornfield Hall and falls in love with her enigmatic employer, Mr. Rochester.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bront√´
body: A tale of love, revenge, and tragedy set on the Yorkshire moors, involving the Earnshaw and Linton families.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
body: A young boy named Huckleberry Finn escapes his abusive father and travels down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave named Jim.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
body: Captain Ahab obsessively pursues a giant white whale named Moby Dick, leading his crew on a dangerous and destructive voyage.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
body: The epic journey of Odysseus, king of Ithaca, as he struggles to return home after the Trojan War, facing many obstacles and adventures.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
body: The story of the Trojan War, focusing on the wrath of Achilles and the battle between the Greeks and Trojans.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
body: An allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
body: The adventures of a delusional nobleman who sets out to revive chivalry, accompanied by his squire Sancho Panza.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garc√≠a M√°rquez
body: The multi-generational saga of the Buend√≠a family in the fictional town of Macondo, Colombia.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
body: A poor student murders a pawnbroker and is tormented by guilt and paranoia as he tries to evade the police.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
body: A sweeping epic set during the Napoleonic Wars, following the lives of five aristocratic Russian families.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
body: A married woman has an affair with a young officer, leading to social ostracism and personal tragedy.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
body: A bored housewife seeks excitement and romance outside of her marriage, leading to financial ruin and despair.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
body: A man is indifferent to the world around him and is arrested for murdering a man on a beach, leading to an existential exploration of life and meaning.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
body: Holden Caulfield, a cynical teenager, narrates his expulsion from boarding school and his subsequent wanderings through New York City.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
body: Jay Gatsby, a self-made millionaire, throws extravagant parties in the hopes of reuniting with his former love, Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
body: Scout Finch narrates the story of her father, Atticus Finch, a lawyer who defends a black man falsely accused of rape in the racially charged American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
body: The Bennet sisters navigate love, marriage, and social expectations in 19th-century England.

author: George Orwell
body: Winston Smith rebels against the totalitarian state of Oceania, where Big Brother controls every aspect of life.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
body: Animals on a farm revolt against their human farmer, but their revolution is betrayed, and they end up under the rule of the pigs.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: Frodo Baggins and his companions embark on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron in Middle-earth.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, goes on an adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
body: Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
body: The Pevensie children discover the magical world of Narnia through a wardrobe and become involved in the battle between good and evil.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
body: Arthur Dent's adventures as he travels through the galaxy with his friend Ford Prefect after Earth is destroyed.

title: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
author: Douglas Adams
body: The second book in the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, where Arthur Dent and his companions continue their hilarious and absurd adventures.

title: Life, the Universe and Everything
author: Douglas Adams
body: The third book in the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, where Arthur Dent and his friends search for the ultimate question to life, the universe, and everything.

title: So Long, and Thanks for All the Fish
author: Douglas Adams
body: The fourth book in the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, where Arthur Dent returns to a recreated Earth and falls in love.

title: Mostly Harmless
author: Douglas Adams
body: The fifth and final book in the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, where the Earth is destroyed again, and Arthur Dent faces the end of the universe.

title: The Man in the High Castle
author: Philip K. Dick
body: An alternate history where the Axis powers won World War II, and the United States is divided between Japan and Nazi Germany.

title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philip K. Dick
body: A bounty hunter tracks down rogue androids in a post-apocalyptic San Francisco, questioning the nature of humanity and reality.

title: Ubik
author: Philip K. Dick
body: A group of anti-psychics are attacked, and their world begins to unravel as reality itself becomes unstable.

title: A Scanner Darkly
author: Philip K. Dick
body: An undercover narcotics agent becomes addicted to the drug he is investigating, leading to a fragmented and paranoid reality.

title: Flow My Tears, the Policeman Said
author: Philip K. Dick
body: A famous television personality wakes up one day to find that no one remembers who he is, and he is trapped in a bizarre and shifting reality.

title: The Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Hari Seldon, a psychohistorian, predicts the fall of the Galactic Empire and creates a Foundation to preserve knowledge and rebuild civilization.

title: Foundation and Empire
author: Isaac Asimov
body: The Foundation faces challenges from the remnants of the Galactic Empire and a powerful mutant known as The Mule.

title: Second Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
body: The Foundation searches for the Second Foundation, a secret organization that is crucial to Hari Seldon's plan for the future.

title: Foundation's Edge
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Golan Trevize, a Councilman of the Foundation, investigates a mysterious planet called Gaia and must make a decision that will affect the future of humanity.

title: Foundation and Earth
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Golan Trevize continues his search for the origins of humanity and encounters a powerful entity that holds the key to the future.

title: The Robots of Dawn
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Detective Elijah Baley investigates a roboticide on the planet Aurora, uncovering secrets that could threaten the relationship between humans and robots.

title: Robots and Empire
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Elijah Baley's descendants face challenges as they try to establish a human presence in the galaxy, while robots play an increasingly important role.

title: The Caves of Steel
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Elijah Baley teams up with a humanoid robot named R. Daneel Olivaw to solve a murder in a crowded city on Earth.

title: The Naked Sun
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Elijah Baley investigates a murder on the planet Solaria, where humans live in isolation and rely on robots for all their needs.

title: The Gods Themselves
author: Isaac Asimov
body: Humans discover a parallel universe and establish contact with aliens, but their interaction threatens to destabilize both universes.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Genly Ai, an envoy from Earth, visits the planet Gethen, where the inhabitants are ambisexual and can change their sex at will.

title: The Dispossessed
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Shevek, a physicist from the anarchist planet Anarres, visits the capitalist planet Urras, challenging the social and political norms of both worlds.

title: A Wizard of Earthsea
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Ged, a young wizard, learns to control his powers and faces the consequences of his arrogance and mistakes.

title: The Tombs of Atuan
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Tenar, a young priestess, is trapped in a labyrinthine temple and encounters Ged, the wizard, leading to a confrontation between their beliefs and powers.

title: The Farthest Shore
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Ged and Arren, the prince of Enlad, journey to the edge of the world to restore the balance of magic and prevent the world from fading.

title: Tehanu
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Tenar, now an older woman, cares for a young girl who has been abused and abandoned, exploring themes of power, gender, and healing.

title: The Lathe of Heaven
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: George Orr, a man whose dreams alter reality, is manipulated by a psychiatrist who tries to use his powers to reshape the world.

title: The Word for World is Forest
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: The peaceful Athsheans, who live in harmony with their forest world, are exploited and enslaved by human colonists, leading to a conflict between cultures and values.

title: The Telling
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: Sutty, an observer from the Ekumen, visits the planet Aka, where the government suppresses the ancient Telling, a complex system of beliefs and rituals.

title: Always Coming Home
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
body: A collection of stories, poems, and anthropological notes about the Kesh, a people who live in a sustainable and egalitarian society in a future California.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: Frodo Baggins and his companions embark on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron in Middle-earth.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, goes on an adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: A collection of myths and legends that tell the history of Middle-earth from its creation to the events of The Lord of the Rings.

title: The Children of H√∫rin
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: The tragic story of T√∫rin Turambar, a man cursed by the Dark Lord Morgoth, and his sister Ni√´nor.

title: Beren and L√∫thien
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: The tale of Beren, a mortal man, and L√∫thien, an elf princess, who defy fate and Morgoth's power to be together.

title: The Fall of Gondolin
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: The story of the hidden city of Gondolin and its destruction by Morgoth's forces.

title: The Adventures of Tom Bombadil
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: A collection of poems about Tom Bombadil, a mysterious and ancient being who lives in the Old Forest.

title: The Road Goes Ever On
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: A collection of poems and songs from The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit, set to music by Donald Swann.

title: Smith of Wootton Major
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: A short story about a young boy who finds a magical star and enters the realm of Faery.

title: Farmer Giles of Ham
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
body: A humorous tale about a farmer who becomes a hero after accidentally defeating a giant.
